alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 5:51PM PDT until August 25 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN SAN DIEGO COUNTY... At 551 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have dissipated in the Vallecito Wash and highway S2 in the San Diego deserts. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing along and near highway S2. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hwy 78 between S2 and Borrego Springs Rd, Mount Laguna, Hwy 78 between Borrego Springs Rd and Ocotillo Wells, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Borrego Springs, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Fish Creek Wash, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd and Hwy S2 Between Canebrake And Imperial County Line. Vallecito Wash Impacts to highway S2 FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
